meanings.sent1: The strong wind repelled the leaves from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The knight repelled the enemy troops with his sword.
meanings.sent3: The cat was repelled by the taste of the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed repelled any doubts that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The repellent spray effectively repelled the mosquitoes.

meanings.definition: To cause aversion or distaste in
meanings.sent1: The foul smell repelled the guests from entering the room.
meanings.sent2: The spoiled food repelled everyone at the picnic.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs may repel some, but it's a delicacy in other cultures.
meanings.sent4: The gruesome scene in the movie repelled the audience.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine was so repelling that she couldn't swallow it.

meanings.sent1: She repelled the temptation to eat the entire cake.
meanings.sent2: The superhero repelled the villain's attack with ease.
meanings.sent3: The magnet repelled the other magnet when they tried to connect.
meanings.sent4: His strong beliefs repelled any attempts to sway his opinion.
meanings.sent5: The repellent smell of the garbage repelled the rodents from entering the house.

meanings.definition: To push away or keep at a distance
meanings.sent1: The mother bird repelled the predator from her nest.
meanings.sent2: He used a stick to repel the stray dog approaching him.
meanings.sent3: The force field repelled any objects trying to pass through it.
meanings.sent4: The strong magnetic field repelled the metal objects around it.
meanings.sent5: The repellent spray helped repel the ants from invading the kitchen.
